intro: Strobilanthes urticifolia, commonly known as the strobilanthes with urticating hairs, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its unique inflorescence, which consists of dense clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and swamps. Its leaves are covered in fine, irritating hairs, which can cause skin irritation upon contact. Strobilanthes urticifolia is part of the Acanthaceae family and is known for its ecological importance in supporting local insect populations.
